meanings.definition: To confirm or attest to the truth or accuracy of something.
meanings.sent1: I will certify that the document is genuine.
meanings.sent2: The teacher will certify the students' test scores.
meanings.sent3: The detective needed to certify the suspect's alibi.
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to certify her happiness.
meanings.sent5: The stamp on the letter will certify its delivery.

meanings.definition: To officially recognize or declare something as meeting certain standards or requirements.
meanings.sent1: The inspector will certify the building as safe.
meanings.sent2: The board will certify the company's compliance with regulations.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to certify the dish as delicious before serving it.
meanings.sent4: The badge on his uniform certified his authority.
meanings.sent5: The seal on the package will certify its contents.
